script.description: Path of the script to launch

name.description: Process name in the process list. Defaults to script filename without the extension (app for app.js)

cwd.description: Current working directory to start the process with. Defaults to CWD of the current environment (from your shell)

args.description: Arguments to pass to the script

interpreter.description: Interpreter absolute path. Defaults to node

node_args.description: Arguments to pass to the interpreter

output.description: File path for stdout (each line is appended to this file)

error.description: File path for stderr (each line is appended to this file)

log.description: File path for combined stdout and stderr (each line is appended to this file)

log_type.description: Define a specific log output type

log_date_format.description: Format for log timestamps in moment.js format (eg YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm Z)

env.description: Specify environment variables to be injected

max_memory_restart.description: Restart the app if an amount of memory is exceeded (format: /0-9?/ K for KB, ‘M’ for MB, ‘G’ for GB, default to B)

pid_file.description: File path where the pid of the started process is written by pm2. Defaults to ~/.pm2/pids/app_name-id.pid

restart_delay.description: Time in ms to wait before restarting a crashing app

source_map_support.description: Enable or disable the source map support

disable_source_map_support.description: Enable or disable the source map support

wait_ready.description: Make the process wait for a process.send(‘ready’)

instances.description: Number of instances to be started in cluster mode

kill_timeout.description: Time in ms before sending the final SIGKILL signal after SIGINT

listen_timeout.description: Time in ms before forcing a reload if app is still not listening/has still not sent ready

cron_restart.description: A cron pattern to restart your app

merge_logs.description: In cluster mode, merge each type of logs into a single file (instead of having one for each cluster)

vizion.description: Enable or disable the versioning metadatas (vizion library)

autorestart.description: Enable or disable auto restart after process failure

watch.description: Enable or disable the watch mode

watch_options.description: Object that will be used as an options with chokidar (refer to chokidar documentation)

min_uptime.description: Minimum uptime of the app to be considered started (format is /[0-9]+(h|m|s)?/, for hours, minutes, seconds, default to ms)

max_restarts.description: Number of times a script is restarted when it exits in less than min_uptime

force.description: Start a script even if it is already running (only the script path is considered)

append_env_to_name.description: Append the environment name to the app name

post_update.description: List of commands executed after a pull/upgrade operation performed from Keymetrics dashboard

trace.description: Enable or disable the transaction tracing

disable_trace.description: Enable or disable the transaction tracing

increment_var.description: Specify the name of an environment variable to inject which increments for each cluster

instance_var.description: Rename the NODE_APP_INSTANCE environment variable. Defaults to NODE_APP_INSTANCE

treekill.description: Only kill the main process, not detached children

port.description: Shortcut to inject a PORT environment variable

uid.description: Set user id. Defaults to current user uid

gid.description: Set group id. Defaults to current user gid

^env_\\S*$.description: Specify environment variables to be injected when using –env

ssh_options.description: SSH options with no command-line flag, see ‘man ssh’

pre-setup.description: Pre-setup command or path to a script on your local machine

post-setup.description: Post-setup commands or path to a script on the host machine

apps.description: The apps property is an array of object where each object contains the configuration for each process.

deploy.description: The deploy property is an object where each of its properties is an object which defines a deployment environment.
